definition: can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: It includes strategies and skills. The self-regulation theory emphasizes children's activation and flexibility.
sentences.chinese: 自我调控理论强调儿童的能动性和灵活性。

sentences.english: Explore your activeness, think hard, attend to discussion in class.
sentences.chinese: 发挥主观能动性，勤于思考，积极课堂讨论。

sentences.english: To develop students' reasonable abilities to recover from frustrations and grasp the activity of frustrations.
sentences.chinese: 培养学生受挫后的恢复力，把握挫折的能动性。

sentences.english: The most important properties of sensuous activity are passiveness and activeness.
sentences.chinese: 感性活动原则的最重要特征是受动性与能动性。

sentences.english: Marijuana can decrease sperm motility and increase the number of abnormal sperm.
sentences.chinese: 大麻会降低精子能动性和增加不正常精子的数目。

sentences.english: In the actual competition, notice the motivation and the actual effect applied by active attack.
sentences.chinese: 在实战比赛中，注重主动进攻运用的能动性和实效性。

sentences.english: However, the result is predicted by the individual's subjective initiative of adjustment.
sentences.chinese: 但是预测的结果也是可由个人的主观能动性所调整。

definition: socialization/to socialize/to fit into society/to train sb for society
ability to make one's own decisions
the objective world (as opposed to empirical observation)
